metadata.Title: CVE-2012-3505 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Tinyproxy 1.8.3 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU and memory consumption) via (1) a large number of headers or (2) a large number of forged headers that trigger hash collisions predictably. bucket.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3505` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tinyproxy - 1.8.3-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tinyproxy package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.3-3ubuntu1').
